choices.text: High birth rate and high death rate
Decreasing birth rate and decreasing death rate
Decreasing death rate and stationary birth rate
Low birth rate and low death rate

questions.text: In demographic cycle, late expanding stage indicates
questions.solution:
There is a demographic cycle of 5 stages through which a nation passes.

First stage (High stationary): This stage is characterized by a high birth rate and high death rate which cancel each other and the population remains stationary. Till 1920, India was in this stage.

Second stage (Early expanding): The death rate begins to decline while the birth rate remains unchanged. As the birth rates remain high, the population starts to grow rapidly.

Third stage (Late expanding)- Death rate declines still further and birth rate tends to fall, but population tends to grow as birth rate supersedes the death rates, but rates of population growth decelerates.

Fourth stage (Low stationary)- This stage is characterized by low birth and low death rate with the result that the population becomes stationary. Most industrialized countries have gone through a demographic transition from a high birth and high death rates to low birth and low death rates.

Fifth stage (Declining): Population begins to decline because birth rate is lower than death rate.

questions.text: In calculating dependency ratio numerator is expressed as
questions.solution:
Persons above 65 years and children below 15 years are considered to be dependent on economically productive age group 15-64 years

The ratio of combined age group 0-14 years(young age DR) plus 65 years and above(old age DR) to the 15-64 years age group is known as total  dependency ratio.

  • Total dependency ratio =

Age group 0-14 yrs + age group above 65 yrs

Age group between 15-64 yrs

  • It is also referred to as the societal dependency ratio

questions.text: The growth pattern of a population with an annual growth rate of 1.0 - 1.5% is
questions.solution:
Relation between Annual Growth Rate and population growth are as follows

  • AGR < 0.5 -> Slow growth
  • AGR 0.5- 1 -> Moderate growth
  • AGR 1- 1.5 -> Rapid growth
  • AGR 1.5- 2 -> Very rapid growth
  • AGR > 2 -> Explosive growth

questions.text: Which one of the following is a dual record system consisting of continuous enumeration of birth and death by enumerator and which indicates survey every six months?
questions.solution: The SRS in India is based on a dual record system. The field investigation under Sample Registration System consists of continuous enumeration of births and deaths in a sample of villages/urban blocks by a resident part time enumerator, and an independent six-monthly retrospective survey by a full-time supervisor. The data obtained through these two sources are matched. The unmatched and partially matched events are re-verified in the field to get an unduplicated count of correct events. The advantage of this procedure, in addition to elimination of errors of duplication, is that it leads to a quantitative assessment of the sources of distortion in the two sets of records making it a self evaluating technique

questions.text: Which IUCD acts for 10 years?
questions.solution:
• CuT 380A - It is a T shaped device with a polyethylene frame holding 380 mm2 of exposed surface area of copper. The IUD frame contains barium sulfate thus making it radio-opaque.
  • Life span of CuT 380A is for 10years whereas other copper T devices last for around 5 years
  • Mechanism of Action: IUD mainly work by changing the intra-uterine environment and making it spermicidal. Non-medicated IUD cause a sterile inflammatory response by producing a tissue injury of minor degree but sufficient enough to be spermicidal. Copper containing IUD, in addition, release free copper and copper salts that have both a biochemical and morphological impact on the endometrium and also produce alteration in cervical mucus and endometrial secretions. No measurable increase in serum copper is observed

choices.text: Biweekly supplementation of iron and FA to 6-60 months of age
Biweekly supplementation of iron and FA to pregnant and lactating women
Biweekly supplementation of iron and FA to adolescent girls
All of the above are parts of initiative

questions.text: National iron plus initiative includes
questions.solution:
Strategies under National iron plus initiative:

6- 60 months 1ml of IFA syrup containing 20mg of elemental iron & 100mcg of folic acid Biweekly throughout the period 6-60months of age & deworming for children 12months & above

5 - 10 years Tablets of 45mg elemental iron & 400mcg of folic acid Weekly throughout the period 5-10 years of age & biannual de-worming done in school through teachers

10 -19 years 100mg elemental iron & 500mcg of folic acid Weekly throughout the period 10-19yrs of age & biannual de-worming. In school through teachers & for out of school children through AWC

Pregnant & Lactating women 100mg elemental iron & 500mcg of folic acid 1 tablet daily for 180 days, starting after the first trimester, at 14-16 weeks of gestation. To be repeated for 180 days post-partum ANC/ANM/ASHA

Women in reproductive age group 100mg elemental iron & 500mcg of folic acid weekly throughout the reproductive period done Through ASHA during house visit for contraceptive distribution

questions.text: IMCI was taken to prevent morbidity and mortality from all except
questions.solution:
Integrated Management of Childhood Illness (IMCI)

IMCI is an integrated approach to child health that focuses on the well-being of the whole child. IMCI aims to reduce death, illness and disability, and to promote improved growth and development among children under five years of age.

It mainly covers 5 diseases pneumonia, diarrhoea, malaria, measles and malnutrition.

  • IMNCI (Indian version of IMCI) includes- ORT, antibiotics for sepsis, pneumonia and ear infection, antimalarials and ITBN, Vit A, treatment of anemia, promotion of breast feeding and complementary feeding

questions.text: The famous paediatrician who devised the growth charts for children was
questions.solution: David Cornelius Morley was a British pediatrician and Emeritus Professor of Child Health. While working in Nigeria he developed the 'Road to health' chart, a parent-held growth chart for monitoring a child's weight to detect early signs of malnutrition. The concept of parent-held growth charts has now been copied globally.

questions.text: Most cost effective method of Family Planning is
questions.solution: Vasectomy is be simpler, safer, easier, and less expensive than female sterilization

questions.text: In calculating RDA for a particular nutrient, 2 SD is not added for
questions.solution:
The recommended dietary allowance (RDA) is the average daily dietary intake level that suffices to meet the nutrient requirements of nearly all (97–98%) healthy persons of a specific sex, age, life stage, or physiological condition (such as pregnancy or lactation).

RDA is defined as two standard deviations above the average requirement, assuming that the distribution of nutrient requirements is normal

So RDA is Mean+ 2 SD for all nutrients except for energy

questions.text: ICDS does not cover
questions.solution:
The Integrated Child Development Service (ICDS) Scheme is one of the world’s largest programmes providing for an integrated package of services for the holistic development of the child.

The ICDS Scheme offers a package of six services

  • Supplementary Nutrition
  • Pre-school non-formal education
  • Nutrition & health education
  • Immunization
  • Health check-up and
  • Referral service

questions.text: Sickness benefit under ESI Act extended upto
questions.solution:
Sickness Benefit(SB): Sickness Benefit in the form of cash compensation at the rate of 70 per cent of wages is payable to insured workers during the periods of certified sickness for a maximum of 91 days in a year.

Extended Sickness Benefit(ESB): SB extendable upto two years in the case of 34 malignant and long-term diseases at an enhanced rate of 80 per cent of wages.

Enhanced Sickness Benefit: Enhanced Sickness Benefit equal to full wage is payable to insured persons undergoing sterilization for 7 days/14 days for male and female workers respectively.

questions.text: What is the colour coding of bag in hospitals to dispose of human anatomical wastes such as body parts?
questions.solution:
The latest guidelines for segregation of bio-medical waste recommend the following color coding:

Red Bag – Syringes (without needles), soiled gloves, catheters, IV tubes etc. should be all disposed of in a red colored bag

Yellow Bag – All dressings, bandages and cotton swabs with body fluids, blood bags, human anatomical waste, body parts are to be discarded in yellow bags.

Cardboard box with blue marking – Glass vials, ampules, other glass ware is to be discarded in a cardboard box with a blue marking/sticker.

White Puncture Proof Container (PPC) – Needles, sharps, blades are disposed of in a white translucent puncture proof container.

Black Bags – These are to be used for non-bio-medical waste.

questions.text: Environmental manipulation to which enable genes to express themselves readily is known as
questions.solution:
Euthenics is the study of the improvement of human functioning and well-being by improvement of living conditions. Environment Affecting the 'improvement' through altering external factors such as education and the controllable environment, including the prevention and removal of contagious disease and parasites, education regarding employment, home economics, sanitation, and housing.

 Eugenics is the science of modifying the human population by selective breeding, with the intention of 'improving' the human race.The eugenics concept was originally developed by Sir Francis Galton in 1883; the word means 'well-born'

Two types of eugenics-

1. Positive eugenics

  • Encouraging reproduction among the genetically advantaged.

Eg: Invitro fertilization, egg transplants, cloning

2. Negative eugenics

  • Lowering fertility among genetically disadvantaged.

Eg: Abortion, sterilization & other family planning methods

questions.text: Economic benefits of any program are compared with the cost incurred in
questions.solution:
Cost- Benefit Analysis

  • Management technique where economic benefits of any program are compared with cost of that program
  • Benefits are expressed in monetary terms
  • Drawback is that all benefits in the field of health cannot be expressed in monetary terms

Cost- Effective Analysis

  • Management technique where benefits are expressed in terms of results achieved
  • eg: number of lives saved or number of days free from disease, heart attacks avoided

questions.text: The distance from airport or seaport which has to be kept free from mosquitoes is
questions.solution:
• The vector for Yellow Fever is -> Aedes mosquito.
  • Airports and seaports have to be kept free from the breeding of insect vectors for a distance of 400 meters.
  • 'Aedes aegyptii index' should not be more than 1%
  • A traveller without a 'valid international certificate of vaccination' is placed on quarantine for 6 days.
  • Validity of vaccination certificate: Begins 10 days after vaccination, and extends ->'LIFE LONG'

questions.text: Indicator solution in Horrock's Apparatus contains
questions.solution:
Horrock's apparatus is used for estimating the dose of bleaching powder needed to disinfect 455 Liters of water. Usually used while disinfecting the water in a well

Contents of 'Horrock's Apparatus'

  • 6 white cups, each of 200 ml capacity
  • One black cup with a circular mark on the inside
  • 2 metal spoons (each holds 2g of bleaching powder when filled up to the brim)
  • 7 glass stirring rods
  • One special pipette
  • Two droppers
  • Starch - iodide indicator solution
  • Instruction folder

questions.text: The best parameter to measure air pollution is
questions.solution:
Chemical indicators of air pollution

  1. Sulphur dioxide
  2. Smoking/Soiling Index
  3. Grit and dust measurement
  4. Co-efficient of haze
  5. Air pollution index

The best parameter to measure air pollution is Sulphur dioxide

The best biological parameter to measure air pollution are Lichens

questions.text: Which of the following is 4th generation IUCD
questions.solution:

  • Very flexible without plastic body
  • Release Copper alone or copper and hormone releasing intrauterine implants

Examples are:  Gynefix-CU,  Fibroplant-Levonorgestrel

questions.text: Example of cyclo-propagative transmission is
questions.solution:
Biological transmission- 3 types

1. Propagative

Disease agent merely multiplies in the body of vector but no change in form.

Plague bacilli in Rat flea and Yellow fever in mosquito

2. Cyclo-propagative

In this type of transmission, the pathogen undergoes a developmental cycle (changes from one stage to another) as well as multiplication in the body of the arthropod

Eg: malarial parasite in mosquito

3. Cyclo-developmental

Agent undergoes only development but no multiplication

Microfilaria in mosquito, and Guinea worm embryo in cyclops.

questions.text: Which one is an example of ONE WAY communication?
questions.solution:
• One-way communication is also known as Didactic methodàflow of communication is one way, from communicator to audience
  • Two-way communication is also known as Socratic methodàboth the communicator and the audience take part

questions.text: GATHER approach is useful for
questions.solution:
GATHER Approach is a method of communication used in counselling. It involves the following steps

  • G -> Greet clients
  • A -> Ask problems or reason for coming
  • T -> Telling different choices
  • H -> Help clients to make voluntary decisions
  • E -> Explain fully the chosen decision
  • R -> Return for follow-up visit

questions.text: DOC for emergency contraception
questions.solution: Emergency contraception should be taken as soon as possible after unprotected intercourse. Drug of choice is considered Levonorgestrel tab of 1.5 mg or two tabs of 0.75 mg stat should be taken within 72 hours after intercourse.

questions.text: All of the following are pillars of primary health care except
questions.solution:
Principles are of primary health care are 4 in number

  1. Equitable distribution
  2. Community participation
  3. Appropriate technology
  4. Intersectoral Co-ordination

questions.text: As compared to Cow's milk, human milk has
questions.solution: Human milk is richer in carbohydrate(lactose), Iron and water content while cow’s milk is richer in fat protein, calcium and energy

questions.text: What is the best determinant of health status of a country?
questions.solution:
Infant Mortality Rate (IMR)

  • Single best indicator of socio-economic development of a country
  • Most important indicator of health status of a community
  • Level of living of people in general: IMR
  • Effectiveness of MCH services: IMR
  • Largest single age category of mortality

questions.text: Condom vending machine at petrol pump is an example for
questions.solution: Social marketing is the use of commercial marketing principles and techniques to improve the welfare of people and the physical, social and economic environment in which they live. It is a carefully planned, long-term approach to changing human behavior.  In social marketing, price is the cost of changing behaviors. The goal of social marketing is to reframe the recommended behavior change.  It might mean offering free or inexpensive condoms at convenient locations

questions.text: All of the following deaths are included in as causes of maternal death except
questions.solution:
Maternal death is defined as the death of a woman while pregnant or within 42 days of termination of pregnancy from any cause related to pregnancy but not from accidental or incidental causes.

Maternal Mortality Ratio=

Total no. of maternal deaths in an area during a given year  X100000

     Total no. of live births in the same area and year

questions.text: Average number of girls that would be born to a woman if she experiences the current fertility pattern throughout her reproductive span assuming no mortality is known as
questions.solution: • Gross Reproduction Rate is defined as the number of daughters a MARRIED WOMAN would bear during her lifetime assuming that she WILL NOT DIE till she completes her reproductive period. IN NRR mortality rates are considered but in GRR mortality rates asre not considered

questions.text: The completed family size may be estimated by:
questions.solution:
• TFR- denotes completed family size.
  • Calculated by summing up single year age specific rates at a given time
  • It is a synthetic measure
  • TFR india = 2.2 (2017)

questions.text: Which of the following year in history of Indian demography is known as year of big divide?
questions.solution: The year 1921 is called 'The Great Divide' in India because the time India has 'Low rate of mortality and High rate birth'. Because of famine, there was a serious condition. 1911 to 1921 period decreasing the population due to incurable diseases. The census year 1911- 1921 registered a negative growth rate of-0.31 per cent which happened only once throughout the demographic history of India.

questions.text: Basel convention is associated with which of the following
questions.solution: Basel Convention deals with the Control of Transboundary Movements of Hazardous Wastes and Their Disposal. It is an international treaty that was designed to reduce the movements of hazardous waste between nations, and specifically to prevent the transfer of hazardous waste from developed to less developed countries (LDCs).

questions.solution:
The latest guidelines for segregation of bio-medical waste recommend the following color coding:

Red Bag – Syringes (without needles), soiled gloves, catheters, IV tubes etc. should be all disposed of in a red colored bag

Yellow Bag – All dressings, bandages and cotton swabs with body fluids, blood bags, human anatomical waste, body parts are to be discarded in yellow bags.

Cardboard box with blue marking – Glass vials, ampules, other glass ware is to be discarded in a cardboard box with a blue marking/sticker.

White Puncture Proof Container (PPC) – Needles, sharps, blades are disposed of in a white translucent puncture proof container.

Black Bags – These are to be used for non-bio-medical waste.

questions.text: All the following Gases are implicated in DCS except
questions.solution: The main inert gases causing Decompression sickness are nitrogen, helium and oxygen

questions.text: Thickness of lead apron to prevent radiation exposure radiation exposure is
questions.solution: Lead aprons are the primary radiation protective garments used by workers. An apron with 0.5-mm thickness can attenuate approximately 90% or more of the scatter radiation. Lead aprons should have at least 0.25-mm lead-equivalent thickness on the back and front. Wraparound-type aprons are designed with 0.25 + 0.25 mm lead-equivalent thickness in the front (0.5 mm total)

questions.text: In extended definition of perinatal mortality, crown heel length is
questions.solution:
For international comparison, the WHO expert committee defines still birth to be included while calculating perinatal mortality as

  • birth of dead and underweight foetus more than 1000gms
  • birth of dead foetus after attaining viability (> 28 weeks gestation)
  • birth of dead foetus crown heel length > 35cm

questions.text: Which of the following has the lowest sex ratio in India?
questions.solution:
• Sex Ratio->No: of females per 1000 males
  • Sex Ratio of India: 943
  • Highest Sex Ratio is of Kerala: 1084
  • Lowest Sex Ratio is of Haryana-> 877

questions.text: Most commonly reported disease in the post disaster period is
questions.solution:
Diseases common in post disaster are

  1. Gastroenteritis
  2. Respiratory
  3. Leptospirosis
  4. Rickettsiosis
  5. Rabies
  6. Equine encephalitis

Most commonly seen disease is Gastroenteritis

questions.text: In our national family welfare programme, tubectomy or vasectomy can be offered to a couple who has at least how many living children
questions.solution:
CRITERIA FOR STERILISATION

  • Clients should be married (including ever-married).
  • Female clients should be below the age of 49 years (below 60 years for males)and above the age of 22 years.
  • The couple should have at least one child whose age is above one year unless the sterilization is medically indicated.
  • Clients or their spouses must not have undergone sterilization in the past
  • Clients must be in a sound state of mind
  • Mentally ill clients must be certified by a psychiatrist, and a statement should be given by the legal guardian/spouse regarding the soundness of the client’s state of mind.

questions.text: The discipline ergonomics refers to
questions.solution: Ergonomics can roughly be defined as the study of people in their working environment. An ergonomist designs or modifies the work to fit the worker, not the other way around. The goal is to eliminate discomfort and risk of injury due to work.

questions.text: Progressive massive fibrosis of lungs is a feature of
questions.solution:
There are two phases in Coal miners pneumoconiosis/ Anthracosis

Phase 1-> Simple pneumoconiosis following 12yeras of exposure to coal dust

Phase 2-> Progressive massive fibrosis

questions.text: Burning foot syndrome is seen in deficiency of
questions.solution: Burning foot syndrome is seen in deficiency of  Vitamin B5 or Pantothenic acid

questions.text: Daily requirement of dietary fiber by an adult is
questions.solution:
Dietary fibres are made up of Polysaccharides like cellulose, hemicellulose, pectin, gums and mucilage

Daily requirement of dietary fiber by an adult is 40gm

questions.text: Best parameter for assessment of chronic malnutrition

choices.text: Food's ability to stimulate insulin release
Food's ability to stimulate glucagon release
Food's ability to raise blood sugar

questions.text: Glycemic index denotes
questions.solution:
• Glycemic index- measures how quickly 50gm of a particular food’s CHO are converted to sugar and thus affects sugar level over a 2-hr period

Glucose has a highest glycemic index (GI) of 100

choices.text: Pearl index and Life table analysis
Life table analysis and Couple protection rate
Pearl index and Couple protection rate

questions.text: Contraceptive efficacy is measured by
questions.solution:
• Contraceptive efficacy is assessed by measuring the number of unplanned pregnancies that occur during a specified period of exposure and use of a contraceptive method.

Pearl index is used for measuring the failure rate of a contraceptive. It is defined as the number of contraception failures per 100 woman years (HWY) of exposure. It is calculated by the formula:
Failure rate per HWY = Total accidental pregnancies/Total months of exposure × 1200

  • Life-table analysis calculates a failure rate for each month of use. A cumulative failure rate can then compare methods for any specific length of exposure.

questions.text: The amount of protein that is actually available to the body for its various growth and maintenance functions, expressed as a percentage of the total protein ingested in the diet, is
questions.solution:
Net protein utilization (NPU) is one of the methods for assessing protein quality in food.

NPU= Digestibility coefficient XBiological Value

                                        100

The protein requirement varies with the   NPU of dietary protein. If NPU is high, the protein requirement is low and vice versa. Highest NPU is for egg

NPU egg-96

NPU milk-81

Meat-79

Fish-77

questions.text: Today- a contraceptive contains
questions.solution:

  • Chemical present is Nonoxynol -9

questions.text: International food standards include
questions.solution:
Food standards are set up by experts or an authority for measuring quantity, weight, extent, value and quality of a substance 

International food standards àCodex Alimentarius commission is the principal organisation of the worldwide food standards program set by FAO and WHO

Food standards in Indiaà They are formulated along the lines of codex alimentarius. They are of two types 1. Compulsory standards   2. Voluntary standards

Under Compulsory standardsàThe prevention of food adulteration act(PFA) and The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI)

Under Voluntary standardsà ISI, BIS, AGMARK
